page.title: 11Bondleigh Ecol.Birds/Mammals
page.content: {Birds}of particular interest{breeding} at and around{Ashridge Court}are Buzzard, Sparrow Hawk, Marsh, Willow, Coal and Longtailed Tits. Spotted Flycatcher and Tree Pipits. Nuthatch, Tree Creeper, Blackcap, Garden Warbler, the occasional{Common} {White Throat (rare now),}Willow Warbler, Chiff Chaff, the Spotted Flycatcher, (all summer migrants) and Tree Pipits breed in the area. Greenfinch, Goldfinch, Linnet, Grey Wagtails, and Yellow Hammer all breed. {Raven}breed near Yeo Farm beside Taw; Kingfisher, Dipper occasionally seen and Heron feed along River Taw. Wood Warblers have been recorded. {Mammals}- Badgers and foxes are quite numerous. Roe Deer are found in the woods; Red Deer move through the area. Otters have been recorded along the River Taw.
